titleStmt.title: Franklin A. Wilcox to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1867

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
No. 76 Wall St.
New York. May 6. 1864.
To His Excellency
The Governor of
Kentucky.

Dear Sir: I hereby solicity the appointment of Commissioner &c. for your state, resident in New York. I have been a Notary Public for this state five years and am a Commissioner for some twelve of the states, which, together with the letter of Judge Sutherland, enclosed, will be a sufficient assurance to your Excellency. I trust, of the fitness of the appointment desired.

I remain,
Very respectfully &c
Franklin A. Wilcox
